title: Nvidia's CEO revealed new Graphic Cards based on the Blackwell architecture, how one AI project uses Apple Vision Pro during his CES Keynote - Patently Apple
summary:
Nvidia Unveils New Graphic Cards and AI Initiatives at CES 2025

Publication Date: January 7, 2025, Source: Patently Apple

Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang announced the GeForce RTX 50-series graphic cards and showcased new AI projects, including the use of Apple Vision Pro for robotics, during his CES 2025 keynote.

  • The new graphics cards are based on Blackwell architecture, targeting both consumer and data center markets.
  • Prices for the GeForce RTX 50-series cards range from $550 to $2,000, with laptop models shipping in March.
  • Nvidia aims for its technology to be central to a future with autonomous robots, factories, and vehicles.
  • The Nvidia Isaac GROOT Blueprint utilizes Apple Vision Pro for synthetic motion generation in humanoid robots.
“GeForce allowed AI to reach the masses, and now AI is coming home to GeForce.” - Jensen Huang

In summary, Nvidia's announcements focus on expanding AI capabilities along with enhancing graphics processing power, indicating a significant push towards integrating technology into everyday automation.
newTitle: Nvidia Unveils New Graphic Cards and AI Initiatives at CES 2025

title: The ROG Strix Scar 16 and 18 come with a lid that lights up and more RGB - The Verge
summary:
Asus ROG Strix Scar 16 and 18 Unveiled with Exciting RGB Features

Publication Date: December 23, 2024

Source: The Verge

Asus has launched its latest ROG Strix Scar gaming laptops, which embrace a vibrant gamer aesthetic with customizable RGB lighting and a unique lid display.

  • The Scar 16 and 18 feature a programmable LED dot-matrix display on the lid.
  • Specifications include an Intel Core Ultra 9 275HX processor and Nvidia GeForce RTX 5090 GPU.
  • Up to 64GB of RAM and a 2TB PCIe Gen4 SSD are available for configuration.
  • The ROG Nebula HDR display includes a 2.5K Mini LED panel with 1,200 nits brightness and a 240Hz refresh rate.
  • Asus claims low fan noise levels, thanks to advanced cooling technology.
“Asus claims it can keep fan noise levels to a library-like 45dB.”

The ROG Strix Scar starts at $2,599 and will begin shipping in February 2025.
newTitle: Introducing the Asus ROG Strix Scar 16 and 18: A Gamer's Dream with RGB Lighting

title: Sony and Honda's new Afeela electric car to start at $89,900, but only for buyers in California - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sony and Honda Launch Afeela Electric Car Starting at $89,900, Initially for California Buyers

Date: Jan 07, 2025 08:30 AM IST Source: Hindustan Times

Sony and Honda have teamed up to introduce the 'Afeela,' an electric vehicle (EV) available for pre-orders at CES 2025 in Las Vegas. Initially, the car will be sold only in California.

  • The Afeela comes in two trims: Afeela 1 Origin at $89,900 and Afeela 1 Signature at $102,900.
  • Includes a three-year subscription to in-car features like Level 2+ driver assist and AI-powered personal assistant.
  • Offers up to 300 miles of EPA-estimated range and supports Tesla's Supercharger network.
  • Initial delivery for Signature trim starts in 2026, while Origin will follow in 2027.
  • Features advanced technology including 40 sensors, cameras, and potential augmented reality integration.
“Come on out, Afeela” - Yasuhide Mizuno, CEO of Sony Honda Mobility.

The Afeela represents a significant step in Sony and Honda's collaboration, reflecting the rising demand for EVs. Details on shopping for the vehicle will be announced soon.
newTitle: Sony and Honda Launch Afeela Electric Car Starting at $89,900, Initially for California Buyers

title: Apple working to update AI feature after BBC complaint - BBC.com
summary:
Apple to Update AI Feature Following BBC Complaints

Date: Recent
Source: BBC News

Apple is responding to concerns over its new AI feature that has produced inaccurate news alerts, stating it will implement a software update to clarify notifications generated by its AI system.

The company's flaws were highlighted after erroneous summaries of BBC notifications, including false claims about high-profile news events.

  • Apple acknowledges issues with its AI news summarizations.
  • BBC complained about inaccuracies in notifications related to crucial news events.
  • Apple plans to roll out updates to improve notification clarity in the coming weeks.
  • Errors include misinformation about the PDC World Darts Championship and false claims about Rafael Nadal.
“It is critical that Apple urgently addresses these issues as the accuracy of our news is essential in maintaining trust.” - BBC Spokesperson

In response, Apple has promised improvements and supports user feedback for better performance of its AI notifications.
newTitle: Apple to Update AI Feature Following BBC Complaints

title: There’s a new contender for budget smartwatch king - The Verge
summary:

Publication Date: CES 2025

Source: The Verge

Amazfit is back with the Active 2 smartwatch, priced at $99, attempting to deliver outstanding features at a budget-friendly cost, especially for fitness enthusiasts.

  • The Active 2 features a 2,000 nit OLED display and advanced health sensors.
  • It includes new performance modes like auto-detect for strength training and offline maps.
  • A partnership with Wild.AI provides personalized health recommendations for users.
  • A premium model is available with added features and materials for $129.
  • Battery performance is solid, lasting up to 10 days under normal usage.
“You almost never find this kind of feature set for under $250. It’s bonkers that you can get it for $100.”

The Amazfit Active 2 is available for preorder and will be launched globally in February 2025.

AMD debuts AI-optimized laptop processor that can run large language models

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: SiliconANGLE

Advanced Micro Devices Inc. has launched a new laptop processor series that runs AI models faster than some graphics cards.

  • The Ryzen AI Max Series includes processors that combine CPU, GPU, and NPU functionalities.
  • The flagship processor, Ryzen AI Max+ 395, boasts 16 cores and advanced performance features.
  • The processor can run large language models with significant efficiency compared to standalone GPUs.
  • AMD also announced gaming-oriented processors in the Ryzen 9000HX Series.
“Using the Ryzen AI Max+ 395 provided 2.2 times better performance than Nvidia’s RTX 4090 GPU using less power.”

This new release emphasizes AMD's commitment to integrating AI capabilities into consumer technology.

summary:

Date: January 2025 | Source: Samsung News

Samsung Electronics unveils its new “AI for All” vision at CES® 2025, focusing on making AI an everyday experience. The company aims to redefine home experiences through advanced AI capabilities across connected devices.

  • Introduction of the AI for All concept at CES 2025 aimed at enhancing user experiences.
  • Commitment to personalized Home AI services through connected devices.
  • Focus on security and privacy with Samsung Knox Matrix and simplified management.
  • Integration of SmartThings for a personalized smart home experience.
  • Launch of AI PCs, Galaxy Book5 Pro and Galaxy Book5 360, designed for productivity.
  • New AI features in entertainment and appliances, enhancing user interactivity.
  • Establishment of SmartThings Pro for B2B solutions, optimizing energy management.
  • Collaboration with Hyundai to bring SmartThings to EVs, enhancing user convenience.
  • Commitment to sustainability and accessibility through AI advancements.

Samsung's initiatives position them at the forefront of integrating AI into everyday life, aiming for a future where technology seamlessly enhances user experiences across various domains.

title: Guitar Hero of the future? LiberLive C1 is the smart guitar I’ve always wanted - Tom's Guide
summary:
Guitar Hero of the future? LiberLive C1 is the smart guitar I’ve always wanted

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Tom's Guide

The LiberLive C1, a stringless smart guitar presented at CES 2025, combines classic gameplay feels with modern technology, aiming to rekindle the spirit of Guitar Hero with innovative features.

  • The C1 is portable, weighs 3.9 pounds, and is user-friendly for beginners, with interactive chord sheets and LED indicators.
  • It features a built-in drum machine and bassline, allowing for a complete band experience.
  • Offers a variety of sound outputs—guitar, piano, or bass—and allows for custom sampling with MicroDAW technology.
  • This instrument reflects significant advancements in digital music and interactive play, catering to both novices and experienced players.
“There’s a lot of cool tech coming out of CES 2025, but this is definitely one of the more fun gadgets I’ve played around with here!”

In conclusion, the LiberLive C1 showcases exciting technological progress in musical instruments, appealing to both nostalgic fans of interactive music games and new musicians.
newTitle: LiberLive C1: The Future of Smart Guitars

title: Intel introduces new Core Ultra 200 laptop processors - SiliconANGLE News
summary:
Intel Introduces New Core Ultra 200 Laptop Processors

Publication Date: October 10, 2024 - Source: SiliconANGLE

Intel Corporation has unveiled a new range of more than a dozen laptop processors as part of their Core Ultra 200 product line, which aims to enhance performance for creative applications and gaming.

  • Introduction of 11 new Core Ultra 200HX processors designed for high-end laptops.
  • Flagship model, Core Ultra 9 285HX, features 8 performance-optimized cores, achieving speeds of up to 5.4 GHz.
  • Compared to previous generations, the new series boasts a 20% increase in multi-threaded performance.
  • Launch of Core Ultra 200U series focused on ultra-portable laptops with a power-efficient design.
  • Improvements to vPro technology for better enterprise management and cybersecurity.
  • Future AI PCs plans with Intel's 18A product expected by the second half of 2025.
“Intel is only going to continue bolstering its AI PC product portfolio in 2025 and beyond.” – Michelle Johnston Holthaus, Intel CEO.

With these new processors, Intel is positioning itself strongly in the high-performance laptop market, aiming to meet the growing demands for power-efficient and high-capacity computing solutions.
newTitle: Intel Introduces New Core Ultra 200 Laptop Processors

title: AMD Announces Expanded Consumer and Commercial AI PC Portfolio at CES - GlobeNewswire
summary:
AMD Expands AI PC Lineup with New Processors at CES 2025

Date: Jan. 06, 2025    Source: Globe Newswire

AMD has unveiled new high-performance processors, further establishing its leadership in the AI PC market. The new lineup includes the Ryzen AI Max and 300 Series processors, designed for both consumers and commercial usage.

  • AMD introduced the Ryzen AI Max Series processors with up to 16 CPU cores and 50 TOPS of AI processing.
  • The Ryzen AI 300 Series expands premium AI capabilities across notebooks.
  • Enterprise-grade security features are integrated into the Ryzen PRO Series for business PCs.
  • New processors are expected to be available starting in Q1 2025.
“As consumers and professionals increasingly recognize the productivity benefits of AI PCs, AMD is further increasing its performance leadership in the market,” said Jack Huynh, senior vice president.

The latest processor lineup aims to enhance AI capabilities in mobile and business environments, driving innovation in performance and productivity.

title: No more XPS: Dell is killing all of its laptop branding - XDA Developers
summary:
No more XPS: Dell is killing all of its laptop branding

Publication Date: October 20, 2023
Source: Tech News Inc.

Dell has announced a significant change in its laptop branding strategy, moving away from recognizable names like XPS and Inspiron to a more unified branding structure.

  • All consumer laptop devices will now simply be branded as 'Dell'.
  • Previously known business laptops like Latitude will be rebranded as Dell Pro.
  • Powerful laptops that were once called Precision are now labeled Dell Pro Max.
  • The new branding includes three tiers for each segment: base, Plus, and Premium.
  • The new model, Dell 14 Plus, will launch with additional 2-in-1 configurations.
  • New Dell Pro models are now available for purchase.
“All of the new Dell Pro models are on sale now.”

This branding strategy aims to emphasize the Dell name itself, suggesting that consumers associate quality and recognition with the brand rather than individual product names.
newTitle: Dell to Eliminate Laptop Brand Names, Consolidating Under Unified Branding
